results.title: [ImportVerilog] Cannot compile forward declared string type
results.relevance_notes: Directly related to string type handling in MooreToCore. Reports that MooreToCore lacks string-type conversion. Very similar root cause.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Support for StringType from moore to llvm dialect
results.relevance_notes: Feature request for StringType support in MooreToCore. Related to the same underlying issue - string types not properly handled.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Crash with sqrt/floor
results.relevance_notes: Same assertion message 'dyn_cast on a non-existent value' in MooreToCore. Different trigger (real type conversion) but same crash pattern.

results.title: [ImportVerilog] Crash on ordering-methods-reverse test
results.relevance_notes: Crash involving string type in SystemVerilog. Different crash location but related to string handling.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Support for Unsized Array Type
results.relevance_notes: Related to type conversion limitations in MooreToCore. Different type but similar category of issue.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Crash when getting values to observe
results.relevance_notes: MooreToCore crash but different cause (unattached region).

results.title: [MooreToCore] Unexpected observed values in llhd.wait
results.relevance_notes: MooreToCore issue but different problem (sensitivity list handling).

top_issue.title: [ImportVerilog] Cannot compile forward declared string type

recommendation_reason: Issue #8283 directly addresses string type handling in MooreToCore with score 12.5. The current crash (string type as module output port causing assertion in getModulePortInfo) is closely related to the reported lack of string-type conversion support. Issue #8332 also discusses StringType support. This bug may be a specific manifestation of the broader string type support gap.
